records.location_details: Three migrants claimed to be apprehended by Albanian authorities near Gjirokaster, transported to the border with Greece near Kakavia, forced to cross, and subsequently captured by Greek authorities near Mayropoulo and transported to Delvinaki A.
records.where_clear: Albania-Greece border area, specifically near Gjirokaster (Albania) and Kakavia, Mayropoulo, Delvinaki A (Greece).
records.location_text_raw: near Gjirokaster, border with Greece near Kakavia, Mayropoulo, Delvinaki A
records.geocodable_query: Albania-Greece border near Gjirokaster, Kakavia, Mayropoulo, Delvinaki A
records.uncertainty_note: The incident spans an area along the Albania-Greece border, involving multiple points of interest.

possible_violations.legal_basis: Art. 4 of Protocol no. 4 of the European Convention on Human Rights

possible_violations.violation_name: Prohibition of inhuman or degrading treatment
possible_violations.legal_basis: Article 3 of the European Convention on Human Rights

records.context_note: Three migrants from a group of 16 alleged that Albanian authorities transported them to the border with Greece and coerced them to cross, using force, including kicking and one claim of being 'beaten with boots'. The Fundamental Rights Office could not assess the veracity of these allegations but noted their consistency with similar accounts in other SIRs. Albanian authorities denied these allegations, stating all procedures are followed. The FRO could not corroborate the allegations of use of force or transport to the border.
records.evidence_quote: three interviewed migrants travelling as part of a group of 16 claimed to have been apprehended by Albanian authorities near Gjirokaster on 19/03/2022 and subsequently brought to the border with Greece near Kakavia. There, they were forced to follow a path to Greece, while being kicked by "Albanian who were wearing army outfits".
